answers.answer: Hello,In your case it can be due to psychological stress or other causes. Common causes causing erection problem are stress and anxiety, smoking, alcohol and sometimes illicit drugs and medical conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, heart or thyroid conditions, poor circulation, low testosterone, depression, spinal cord injury, nerve damage (for example, from prostate surgery), or neurologic disorders (such as multiple sclerosis or Parkinson's disease). In your case your neurological problem also needs evauation.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Hello doctor.  I've been suffering from erectile dysfunction since my 20s (I'm now 36).  In the last 6 to 9 months, even Levitra and Cialis have stopped being effective.  I've seen a therapist who couldn't find any psychological reason for the problem.  (It doesn't seem likely to be nerves, etc., since I have the same problem when I'm alone, I don't wake up with an erection, etc.) But my urologist did a test with an injection and ultrasound and said there was nothing physically wrong with me.  I'd love to have a better understanding of the problem, but most of all I just want to have some sort of solution.  I'd appreciate your thoughts.I do have neurological problems due to congenital hydrocephalus, does that seem like something that could be a factor?  I didn't have this problem as a teen.)
title: Erectile Dysfunction
